page.title: 15HEADCORN'S LOCAL CONCERN'S
page.content: One of the pressing concerns to the villagers of Headcorn and its visitors is the{problem of parking spaces}for vehicles of all sorts. Moves to provide a car park have,until now,not succeeded. However there is a long awaited plan to build a{by-pass}to the E. of the village. This should ease the traffic congestion. As yet there is no full-scale{public library,}but the planned conversion of part of the Primary School is well advanced. To the S. of the village is{Shenley {Airfield}which causes annoyance to some residents with the sound of light aircraft performing acrobatics or releasing parachutists. There are often complaints about the lack of facilities for the{removal of bulky {household rubbish.}Because of the poor bus service some parents wish to see a {free school bus service}to Tenterden.
